Events.html: 634 – Battle of Ajnadayn: Byzantine forces under Theodore are defeated by the Rashidun Caliphate near Beit Shemesh (modern Israel).
Events.text: Battle of Ajnadayn: Byzantine forces under Theodore are defeated by the Rashidun Caliphate near Beit Shemesh (modern Israel).

Events.html: 762 – Baghdad is founded by caliph Al-Mansur.
Events.text: Baghdad is founded by caliph Al-Mansur.

Events.html: 1419 – First Defenestration of Prague: a crowd of radical Hussites kill seven members of the Prague city council.
Events.text: First Defenestration of Prague: a crowd of radical Hussites kill seven members of the Prague city council.

Events.html: 1502 – Christopher Columbus lands at Guanaja in the Bay Islands off the coast of Honduras during his fourth voyage.
Events.text: Christopher Columbus lands at Guanaja in the Bay Islands off the coast of Honduras during his fourth voyage.

Events.html: 1608 – At Ticonderoga (now Crown Point, New York), Samuel de Champlain shoots and kills two Iroquois chiefs. This was to set the tone for French-Iroquois relations for the next one hundred years.
Events.text: At Ticonderoga (now Crown Point, New York), Samuel de Champlain shoots and kills two Iroquois chiefs. This was to set the tone for French-Iroquois relations for the next one hundred years.

Events.html: 1619 – In Jamestown, Virginia, the first representative assembly in the Americas, the House of Burgesses, convenes for the first time.
Events.text: In Jamestown, Virginia, the first representative assembly in the Americas, the House of Burgesses, convenes for the first time.

Events.html: 1629 – An earthquake in Naples, Italy, kills about 10,000 people.
Events.text: An earthquake in Naples, Italy, kills about 10,000 people.

Events.html: 1635 – Eighty Years' War: The Siege of Schenkenschans begins; Frederick Henry, Prince of Orange, begins the recapture of the strategically important fortress from the Spanish Army.
Events.text: Eighty Years' War: The Siege of Schenkenschans begins; Frederick Henry, Prince of Orange, begins the recapture of the strategically important fortress from the Spanish Army.

Events.html: 1656 – Swedish forces under the command of King Charles X Gustav defeat the forces of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth at the Battle of Warsaw.
Events.text: Swedish forces under the command of King Charles X Gustav defeat the forces of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth at the Battle of Warsaw.

Events.html: 1676 – Nathaniel Bacon issues the "Declaration of the People of Virginia", beginning Bacon's Rebellion against the rule of Governor William Berkeley.
Events.text: Nathaniel Bacon issues the "Declaration of the People of Virginia", beginning Bacon's Rebellion against the rule of Governor William Berkeley.

Events.html: 1729 – Foundation of Baltimore, Maryland.
Events.text: Foundation of Baltimore, Maryland.

Events.html: 1733 – The first Masonic Grand Lodge in the future United States is constituted in Massachusetts.
Events.text: The first Masonic Grand Lodge in the future United States is constituted in Massachusetts.

Events.html: 1756 – In Saint Petersburg, Bartolomeo Rastrelli presents the newly built Catherine Palace to Empress Elizabeth and her courtiers.
Events.text: In Saint Petersburg, Bartolomeo Rastrelli presents the newly built Catherine Palace to Empress Elizabeth and her courtiers.

Events.html: 1811 – Father Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, leader of the Mexican insurgency, is executed by the Spanish in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Mexico.
Events.text: Father Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, leader of the Mexican insurgency, is executed by the Spanish in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Mexico.

Events.html: 1825 – Malden Island is discovered by captain George Byron, 7th Baron Byron.
Events.text: Malden Island is discovered by captain George Byron, 7th Baron Byron.

Events.html: 1859 – First ascent of Grand Combin, one of the highest summits in the Alps.
Events.text: First ascent of Grand Combin, one of the highest summits in the Alps.

Events.html: 1863 – American Indian Wars: Representatives of the United States and tribal leaders including Chief Pocatello (of the Shoshone) sign the Treaty of Box Elder.
Events.text: American Indian Wars: Representatives of the United States and tribal leaders including Chief Pocatello (of the Shoshone) sign the Treaty of Box Elder.

Events.html: 1864 – American Civil War: Battle of the Crater – Union forces attempt to break Confederate lines at Petersburg, Virginia by exploding a large bomb under their trenches.
Events.text: American Civil War: Battle of the Crater – Union forces attempt to break Confederate lines at Petersburg, Virginia by exploding a large bomb under their trenches.

Events.html: 1865 – The steamboat Brother Jonathan sinks off the coast of Crescent City, California, killing 225 passengers, the deadliest shipwreck on the Pacific Coast of the U.S. at the time.
Events.text: The steamboat Brother Jonathan sinks off the coast of Crescent City, California, killing 225 passengers, the deadliest shipwreck on the Pacific Coast of the U.S. at the time.

Events.html: 1866 – New Orleans, Louisiana's Democratic government orders police to raid an integrated Republican Party meeting, killing 40 people and injuring 150.
Events.text: New Orleans, Louisiana's Democratic government orders police to raid an integrated Republican Party meeting, killing 40 people and injuring 150.

Events.html: 1871 – The Staten Island Ferry Westfield's boiler explodes, killing over 85 people.
Events.text: The Staten Island Ferry Westfield's boiler explodes, killing over 85 people.

Events.html: 1912 – Japan's Emperor Meiji dies and is succeeded by his son Yoshihito, who is now known as the Emperor Taishō.
Events.text: Japan's Emperor Meiji dies and is succeeded by his son Yoshihito, who is now known as the Emperor Taishō.

Events.html: 1916 – Black Tom Island explosion in Jersey City, New Jersey.
Events.text: Black Tom Island explosion in Jersey City, New Jersey.

Events.html: 1930 – In Montevideo, Uruguay wins the first FIFA World Cup.
Events.text: In Montevideo, Uruguay wins the first FIFA World Cup.

Events.html: 1932 – Premiere of Walt Disney's Flowers and Trees, the first cartoon short to use Technicolor and the first Academy Award winning cartoon short.
Events.text: Premiere of Walt Disney's Flowers and Trees, the first cartoon short to use Technicolor and the first Academy Award winning cartoon short.

links.subject: Academy Award
links.title: Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film

Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Japanese submarine I-58 sinks the USS Indianapolis, killing 883 seamen.
Events.text: World War II: Japanese submarine I-58 sinks the USS Indianapolis, killing 883 seamen.

Events.html: 1956 – A joint resolution of the U.S. Congress is signed by President Dwight D. Eisenhower, authorizing In God we trust as the U.S. national motto.
Events.text: A joint resolution of the U.S. Congress is signed by President Dwight D. Eisenhower, authorizing In God we trust as the U.S. national motto.

Events.html: 1962 – The Trans-Canada Highway, the largest national highway in the world, is officially opened.
Events.text: The Trans-Canada Highway, the largest national highway in the world, is officially opened.

Events.html: 1965 – U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Social Security Act of 1965 into law, establishing Medicare and Medicaid.
Events.text: U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Social Security Act of 1965 into law, establishing Medicare and Medicaid.

Events.html: 1969 – Vietnam War: US President Richard Nixon makes an unscheduled visit to South Vietnam and meets with President Nguyen Van Thieu and U.S. military commanders.
Events.text: Vietnam War: US President Richard Nixon makes an unscheduled visit to South Vietnam and meets with President Nguyen Van Thieu and U.S. military commanders.

Events.html: 1971 – Apollo program: Apollo 15 Mission – David Scott and James Irwin on the Apollo Lunar Module module Falcon land on the Moon with the first Lunar Rover.
Events.text: Apollo program: Apollo 15 Mission – David Scott and James Irwin on the Apollo Lunar Module module Falcon land on the Moon with the first Lunar Rover.

Events.html: 1971 – An All Nippon Airways Boeing 727 and a Japanese Air Force F-86 collide over Morioka, Iwate, Japan killing 162.
Events.text: An All Nippon Airways Boeing 727 and a Japanese Air Force F-86 collide over Morioka, Iwate, Japan killing 162.

Events.html: 1974 – Watergate scandal: U.S. President Richard Nixon releases subpoenaed White House recordings after being ordered to do so by the Supreme Court of the United States.
Events.text: Watergate scandal: U.S. President Richard Nixon releases subpoenaed White House recordings after being ordered to do so by the Supreme Court of the United States.

links.subject: Supreme Court of the United States
links.title: Supreme Court of the United States

Events.html: 1974 – Six Royal Canadian Army Cadets are killed and fifty-four are injured in an accidental grenade blast at CFB Valcartier Cadet Camp.
Events.text: Six Royal Canadian Army Cadets are killed and fifty-four are injured in an accidental grenade blast at CFB Valcartier Cadet Camp.

Events.html: 1975 – Jimmy Hoffa disappears from the parking lot of the Machus Red Fox restaurant in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, a suburb of Detroit, at about 2:30 p.m. He is never seen or heard from again, and will be declared legally dead on this date in 1982.
Events.text: Jimmy Hoffa disappears from the parking lot of the Machus Red Fox restaurant in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, a suburb of Detroit, at about 2:30 p.m. He is never seen or heard from again, and will be declared legally dead on this date in 1982.

Events.html: 1978 – The 730 (transport), Okinawa Prefecture changes its traffic on the right-hand side of the road to the left-hand side.
Events.text: The 730 (transport), Okinawa Prefecture changes its traffic on the right-hand side of the road to the left-hand side.

links.subject: right-hand side of the road to the left-hand side
links.title: Right- and left-hand traffic

Events.html: 1980 – Vanuatu gains independence.
Events.text: Vanuatu gains independence.

Events.html: 1980 – Israel's Knesset passes the Jerusalem Law
Events.text: Israel's Knesset passes the Jerusalem Law

Events.html: 1990 – George Steinbrenner is forced by Commissioner Fay Vincent to resign as principal partner of New York Yankees for hiring Howie Spira to "get dirt" on Dave Winfield.
Events.text: George Steinbrenner is forced by Commissioner Fay Vincent to resign as principal partner of New York Yankees for hiring Howie Spira to "get dirt" on Dave Winfield.

Events.html: 2003 – In Mexico, the last 'old style' Volkswagen Beetle rolls off the assembly line.
Events.text: In Mexico, the last 'old style' Volkswagen Beetle rolls off the assembly line.

Events.html: 2006 – The world's longest running music show Top of the Pops is broadcast for the last time on BBC Two. The show had aired for 42 years.
Events.text: The world's longest running music show Top of the Pops is broadcast for the last time on BBC Two. The show had aired for 42 years.

Events.html: 2006 – Lebanon War: At least 28 civilians, including 16 children are killed by the Israeli Air Force in what Lebanese call the Second Qana massacre and what Israel considers to be an attempt to stop rockets' being fired, from Lebanon, at Israeli civilian targets.
Events.text: Lebanon War: At least 28 civilians, including 16 children are killed by the Israeli Air Force in what Lebanese call the Second Qana massacre and what Israel considers to be an attempt to stop rockets' being fired, from Lebanon, at Israeli civilian targets.

Events.html: 2012 – A power grid failure leaves seven states in northern India without power, affecting 360 million people.
Events.text: A power grid failure leaves seven states in northern India without power, affecting 360 million people.
